block.p: Dr. Pamela Nina Beth Thurschwell, the daughter of Charlotte and Hubert Thurschwell of Wynnewood, Pa., is to be married today to James John Endersby, a son of Elisabeth B. Escher of Hook Norton, England, and John C. Endersby of Sibford Gower, England. Adrian Wright, a superintendent registrar for the Cambridge District, is to officiate at the Royal Cambridge Hotel in Cambridge, England.

Dr. Thurschwell, 34, will keep her name. She is to begin working tomorrow as a lecturer in English literature at University College in London. She was until Friday a research fellow in 19th- and 20th-century literature at Queens' College of Cambridge University. She is the author of ''Sigmund Freud'' (Routledge, 2000).

Dr. Pamela Nina Beth Thurschwell, the daughter of Charlotte and Hubert Thurschwell of Wynnewood, Pa., is to be married today to James John Endersby, a son of Elisabeth B. Escher of Hook Norton, England, and John C. Endersby of Sibford Gower, England. Adrian Wright, a superintendent registrar for the Cambridge District, is to officiate at the Royal Cambridge Hotel in Cambridge, England.

Dr. Thurschwell, 34, will keep her name. She is to begin working tomorrow as a lecturer in English literature at University College in London. She was until Friday a research fellow in 19th- and 20th-century literature at Queens' College of Cambridge University. She is the author of ''Sigmund Freud'' (Routledge, 2000).

The bride, a magna cum laude graduate of Yale, received a second bachelor's degree from Girton College of Cambridge and a master's degree in English literature from Sussex University in England. She also has a doctorate in English literature from Cornell. Her father retired as the general labor counsel in Philadelphia for what was then Bell Telephone of Pennsylvania. Her mother, a retired lawyer, practiced in Haverford, Pa.

Mr. Endersby, 39, is a doctoral candidate in the history and philosophy of science at Trinity College, Cambridge. He graduated from the University of New South Wales in Australia. His mother is the head of English at the Sibford Friends School, a Quaker boarding school in Sibford Ferris, England. His father retired as a deputy general manager of the central London district of the British national telephone system.
